Class Storage

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipcard.ShipCard
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipcard.Storage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Storage extends ShipCard
Represents a Storage, a specialized type of ShipCard

Different storage types allow different amounts of material and specific material types

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Storage

      public Storage(String id, ShipCard.Connector topConnector, ShipCard.Connector rightConnector, ShipCard.Connector bottomConnector, ShipCard.Connector leftConnector, Storage.Type type)
      Constructs a Storage with specified connectors and type
      Parameters:
      topConnector - The connector on the top side
      rightConnector - The connector on the right side
      bottomConnector - The connector on the bottom side
      leftConnector - The connector on the left side
      type - The type of the storage (defines its capacity and allowed materials)

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public Storage.Type getType()
      Gets the type of this storage unit
      Returns:
      The type of the storage

    • getMaterials

      public List<Material> getMaterials()
      Returns the list of materials currently stored
      Returns:
      The list of materials currently stored

    • checkChooseMaterialsRestrictions

      public void checkChooseMaterialsRestrictions(List<Material> newMaterials, List<Material> oldMaterials)

    • addMaterial

      public void addMaterial(Material newMaterial)
      Adds a new material to the storage. Throws an exception if the storage is full or the material type is incompatible with the storage type
      Parameters:
      newMaterial - The material to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the material is null or the material type is incompatible
      IllegalStateException - If the storage is full and cannot accept more materials

    • removeMaterial

      public void removeMaterial(Material material)
      Removes a specified material from the storage. Throws an exception if the material is not found or the storage is empty
      Parameters:
      material - The material to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the material is null or not found in the storage
      IllegalStateException - If the storage is empty

    • replaceMaterial

      public void replaceMaterial(Material newMaterial, Material oldMaterial)
      Replaces an old material with a new one in the storage. Throws an exception if the storage is empty or the old material is not found
      Parameters:
      newMaterial - The material to replace the old one with
      oldMaterial - The material to remove and replace
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If any of the materials is null or the old material is not found
      IllegalStateException - If the storage is empty

    • getMaterialsValue

      public int getMaterialsValue()
      Calculates and returns the total value of the materials in the storage

      The value is determined by the type of material:

      • RED = 4 coins
      • YELLOW = 3 coins
      • GREEN = 2 coins
      • BLUE = 1 coin
      Returns:
      The total value of the materials in the storage

    • getMostValuedMaterial

      public Material getMostValuedMaterial()
      Retrieves the most valued material from the storage. If no materials are found, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
      Returns:
      the most valued Material
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no material is available in the storage

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this Storage to another object for equality

      Two Storages are considered equal if they are of the same class, pass the equality check of the superclass, and have the same type

      Overrides:
      equals in class ShipCard
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare with this Storage
      Returns:
      true if the given object is a Storage with the same attributes, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code consistent with equals(Object).

      The hash includes the base ShipCard attributes, the storage type, and the current list of materials.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class ShipCard
      Returns:
      the hash code of this storage

      public void place(ShipBoard shipBoard, int x, int y)

      Registers the storage card into the boardâ€™s internal layout and tracking systems.

    • unPlace

      public void unPlace(ShipBoard shipBoard)
      Removes this storage module from the specified ShipBoard.

      Deregisters the component from the board, effectively freeing its position.

      Specified by:
      unPlace in class ShipCard
      Parameters:
      shipBoard - the ship board from which this storage is removed

      Renders this storage card in the CLI interface using the provided renderer.
      Specified by:
      print in class ShipCard
      Parameters:
